ygData.subject: To the ship.
ygData.msgSnippet: Had to write fast, excuse the spelling mistakes. * Iron Raptor was glad that at least Prow had gotten the main thing from that slap, but she only growled when

Had to write fast, excuse the spelling mistakes.

* Iron Raptor was glad that at least Prow had gotten the main thing from 
that slap, but she only growled when she head him chuckle. The sound muffled 
from the cape over her head.
Her shaking had stopped, her spark still pounded but not nearly as bad as it 
had. Calm taking over...and being replaced by annoyance.
She hated heights the Prowl knew that, yet he still dropped like a rock from 
the sky and scared her out of her wits...AGAIN!

Iron Raptor simply sighs deeply, lifting the cape from her eyes and head, 
throwing it back so that it would settle against the ground, then looking at 
the trunks of the trees a bit as Prowl kneels down and
sends his thoughts to her.
Her blue eyes turning to him in a glare.*

< Well, next time when you decide to test them I'M NOT WITH YOU!!!>

* She breaths another sigh  but keeps the glare, eventually getting to her 
feet and dusting herself off.
Then noticing Prowls puppy eyes, only mannaging to get another glare from 
her.*

< That's never worked on me...and NO!>

* Iron Raptor leaned her weight on one leg as she continued to glare at 
Prowl, a look that a mother would give her son when she found out he was 
throwing things around in the house, breaking something that was of value to 
her.*

< You know very well my fear of hights, but you STILL pulled that stunt! If 
you ever, EVER do something like that to me again I'll do way more then just 
slap you!>

* She then looked towards the forest.*

< I've also decided that I'm walking back.I can't trust you anymore.>

* Iron Raptor didn't really want to hurt Prowls feeings or anything like 
that, but he had to get it through his head that he couldn't just joke about 
anymore.
This was a war that they were fighting, and good humour was welcome, but not 
antics and showing off. If Prowl wanted to test his metal, he would have to 
do it on his own time.
Iron Raptor thought this too, so he would get the picture.
Turning towards the direction where the signatures of the ship was coming 
from, noticing three instead of just two. There must have been a stow-away, 
or even maybe a new Maximal for her to meet.*

< Now, we have to get to the ship, or what's left of it.>

* Iron Raptor then began to move into the forest, her cape, surprisingly, 
catching on nothing.
Moving easily into the shadows, her armor soaking them up, or seeming to.
But when she happened to pass under a ray of light which filtered in through 
the branches her air seemed to sparkle, her mind too focused on seeing her 
freinds again and making sure they were alright to notice.*
